Hello,   

I am running Windows XP. I can't boot directly from USB so I need a floppy disk to to the trick. I used Plop boot manager for this. I opened plpbt.img with WinImage and wrote the plpbt.bin into A:\\ . I formated my usb stick in fat32, placed Linux Mint on it and restarted my pc. At boot screen, i selected to boot from floppy, it booted, it showed me the plop menu, i selected USB and it freezed. What seems to be the problem ? Do I have another alternative ? Thanks.

forumNotes.author: Icecube
forumNotes.content:
You can try one of the following from the PLoP main menu  
> u Boot USB  
>
> press SHIFT to force USB 1.1  
> press CTRL to wait for a keypress before starting the operating system. You have here the option to press "n" (next) and continue the search for mass storage devices to boot from another usb device
